text:
I think its out in March sometime, but not 100%.

Here is the trailer actually, I did a couple of tech fixes on the big shot with the crowd and the horse actually.
<https://youtu.be/LOWht-rwNzE>

Ahh awesome! The book is like suuuuuper detailed but it has some good pointers for starting off.
Yeah the weather has been super intense right! Let me know if you want any advice in term of planning your shoot!

text: In Letter For The King we mainly worked on a couple of sequences, one with a load of fire and another that is in the last episode, like the big finale. It was a difficult project but the shots we did ended up looking really nice.

That looks like it could be interesting :smirk: love fantasy stuff like that. Do you ever work on something and just think to yourself can't wait to see all this out together? Haha

Can't wait to watch it see how it all looks!


Yeah, how would you plan a shot out? 

I've made this in 3D it's basically a first person shooter, set in ww2, the camera is a soldier. 

The orange box's are sand dunes the purple box's are the enemy soldiers who get shot by the camera guy and his buddies. Then the falling box's at the end are bombs.
It's just a really quick draft for the planning.

<https://youtu.be/nKNIRAoa3Q4|https://youtu.be/nKNIRAoa3Q4>

Then I've got a horse scene which is primarily half of a horse's head then gonna extend the shot with a 3D version of some stables which I'm gonna light on fire. I've not uploaded the draft for that but will do in a couple of days (just away in Birmingham celebrating 5 years with the missus).

Then the other is an evacuation, based on Dunkirk, I've only really planned on the 3D model placement so far but it's just a still camera like the horse one.

attachments.title: Shooter Scene - Final Mock
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: Shooter Scene - Final Mock

text: If you don't mind me asking how come your moving studios? Just need a change every now and again?

I felt like that for Dark Crystal. I spent such a long time working on it, like over a year, so to see it come out was such a relief and everything came together really well I think :stuck_out_tongue:

The animatic looks good for the FPS shot. I think there is some nice room for some really nice ways for you to show off what you know in a showreel too!

Are these all one part of one project or are you gonna choose one and then do it?

All sounds cool though!

As for moving, it was a number of things really. I have been at Dneg my entire career and have always wanted to move around a bit. Also in the TV department there has been some changes with the way we work that makes it a different place to work. Plus, unfortunately, in VFX its easier to boost your pay packet if you move around a bit. I have always wanted to work at a smaller place for a little while and when I went for an interview I got a really good vibe.

Still not seen dark crystal, were you guys the only studio working on it or one of a few or something? 

Cheers, yeah gonna do all 3 ending on the fps one with the last bomb kind of ending the showreel. I kind of wanted to do something taking inspiration from 1917 with it all in one take or seamlessly blending one shot to another, because I just think it's amazing that, but maybe I'll work on something like that after I finished at uni haha

That's fair enough plus I guess you get to meet all kinds of different people too. Are you gonna doing the same type of role? Hope it all goes well for ya :+1::skin-tone-3:
